intro: Ranunculus weyleri, commonly known as the Weyleri crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from white to yellow and sometimes pink. The plant has basal leaves that are palmately divided, with five to seven lobes, and stems that are often hairy. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. The flowers bloom in early spring and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
